article_title: ColoradoCare Is Better Than the Alternatives
article_text: Regarding Nathan Nascimento’s “Don’t Let ObamaCare’s Failures Snowball Into Single Payer” (Cross Country, Dec. 12) about ColoradoCare: Comparisons to Canada, the Department of Veterans Affairs and Vermont’s dissimilar programs do not make a valid critique. Coloradans have a chance to change from the current system that was designed under the heavy influence of Washington lobbyists and insurers and replace it with a statewide financing plan operated as a cooperative business, owned by the patients and providers of Colorado. Being outside of partisan politics and operated as a locally owned business, it promises to...

article_metadata.article.origheadline: ColoradoCare Is Better Than the Alternatives

article_summary:
Being outside of partisan politics and operated as a locally owned business, it promises to...
Regarding Nathan Nascimento’s “Don’t Let ObamaCare’s Failures Snowball Into Single Payer” (Cross Country, Dec. 12) about ColoradoCare: Comparisons to Canada, the Department of Veterans Affairs and Vermont’s dissimilar programs do not make a valid critique.
Coloradans have a chance to change from the current system that was designed under the heavy influence of Washington lobbyists and insurers and replace it with a statewide financing plan operated as a cooperative business, owned by the patients and providers of Colorado.
